alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 12:39PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues in Huachuca Canyon. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 215 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1232 PM MST, The stream gauge within the Huachuca Canyon has started to lower but is still running high early this afternoon. Thus, small stream flooding is likely continuing in and a bit downstream of the canyon. Another round of thunderstorms are developing over the Huachuca Mountains and if a heavy rainfall producing storm impacts the upper Huachuca Basin again today, additional heavy runoff would be possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huachuca Canyon into Fort Huachuca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
